1.57.text:
My name is Scott Mattson
and I'm our Program Manager

5.71.text:
which is who we're here
to celebrate tonight

10.24.text:
So I'm kinda stalling to see if
they're really ready back there.

22.79.text:
All right, I would
like to announce

24.49.text:
our graduating summer 2017
class for Job Training.

125.36.text:
All right, thanks again
for coming tonight

127.46.text:
to the Leslie E. Tassell
M-TEC.

130.76.text:
We just got some
fresh coats of paint

138.87.text:
so we're showing
that off tonight

140.87.text:
that you can see, but we're
really excited to be here,

143.91.text:
not only to kinda reveal
our new renovations

147.41.text:
but also celebrate
our graduating class,

149.28.text:
so thanks for being
here tonight.

152.22.text:
As you can see from the
people sitting over here,

154.02.text:
this is a very big deal
to us here at the college.

157.46.text:
I am gonna introduce
all of these people

160.19.text:
and let you know what they
do here at the college,

163.03.text:
and also why it is so
important that we support this.

166.57.text:
Then, we're also gonna have
some speeches from some people

171.87.text:
congratulate you for being
their support system,

176.08.text:
We know, as hard as
it was for them,

177.91.text:
it was also equally hard for you
so thank you for your support.

183.65.text:
So first, I'm gonna
start in the back row

187.69.text:
with some of our
Job Training faculty.

189.92.text:
So first, I'm gonna start with
our Automotive instructor,

214.38.text:
Our wonderful counselor,
Dr. Vicki Maxa.

248.75.text:
Also with Computer Support,
Kwasi Joseph.

255.72.text:
And Introduction to
Construction, John Doane.

263.53.text:
We have some world
class faculty here,

266.93.text:
as certainly our
graduates can attest to,

268.90.text:
but we're very fortunate that
many of them come from industry

272.77.text:
and work directly with us,
so we really appreciate

275.58.text:
all the time and energy
they give to us.

279.71.text:
Now, for some of our other staff
and executive team members...

291.39.text:
Our Chief Information Officer,
David Anderson.

306.57.text:
Dr. Kathryn Mullins, our
Executive, uh, Vice President

310.91.text:
of the Board-- of the
Foundation-- sorry.

318.28.text:
From out Board of Trustees,
Cynthia Bristol.

325.59.text:
And also from the Board of
Trustees, Kathleen Bruinsma.

339.04.text:
Our Dean of our School
Workforce Development,

346.18.text:
And our President,
Dr. Bill Pink.

352.29.text:
Thank you for being
here, everyone.

354.59.text:
I wanted to say a special
thank you to Erin Rozek.

357.26.text:
She's probably running
around, getting things ready.

360.03.text:
But her, along with many
of the other staff members

363.53.text:
thank you for getting
this event ready tonight.

366.80.text:
And unlike maybe some other
graduation ceremonies

370.97.text:
you've been to,
they all celebrate,

372.61.text:
and we all ask you to
be here and enjoy it...

375.78.text:
we want this one to be
a little loud and ruckus,

378.38.text:
so we encourage cheering
and yelling when your person

382.01.text:
that you wanna
support is here.

383.42.text:
So it's okay to
yell and scream.

385.02.text:
We highly encourage that,
so please do so.

389.69.text:
So without further ado,
we are gonna go to next,

393.03.text:
which is words to our
graduates from Dr. Bill Pink.

406.37.text:
>> Oh, wait a minute--
good evening!

407.97.text:
>> (all) Good evening!
>> You guys awake over here?

409.91.text:
You guys, we're
celebrating you tonight!

415.52.text:
Okay, now you guys
have to support them

417.28.text:
when I say something
like that,

418.62.text:
so when I said we're
celebrating them,

420.72.text:
then you know
what to do.

421.89.text:
Okay, so we're
celebrating you tonight!

429.93.text:
you know, this is what's fun
about our time here at GRCC,

434.27.text:
as far as graduations
are concerned,

436.94.text:
especially when we have a
Job Training graduation.

441.34.text:
It's all about being able
to say congratulations

444.21.text:
and being able to give
you some encouragement

450.38.text:
and as you go
onto the next.

451.95.text:
And I wanna first of all
start out by thanking you,

455.45.text:
and we'll talk a little bit
more about you here in a second

457.36.text:
as far as some of the
thoughts we share.

460.39.text:
I wanna also-- Scott Mattson,
who just stood in front of you.

463.93.text:
He's our Job Training
Construction Trades Manager.

466.93.text:
He introduces everyone else,
but someone needs to make sure

471.07.text:
they let him know just
how much we appreciate him

475.58.text:
and in his management
of our Job Training

488.02.text:
And as Scott mentioned,
it's good to see our faculty,

493.96.text:
two of our Board members
with Trustee Bruinsma

497.83.text:
We're glad to have
you here tonight.

500.27.text:
I wanna share just a
few words with you,

502.00.text:
and while I talk to them,
you can listen, too.

504.60.text:
It's okay 'cause I'm gonna--
I'll kinda pay attention

507.01.text:
to them but I want
you to listen also,

509.11.text:
because what I tell them,
I need you, once they go home

512.68.text:
and once they're gone,
I need you to reinforce

515.48.text:
I need you to remind of what
we're gonna share with them

518.52.text:
tonight 'cause part of it
involves you anyway.

520.35.text:
I'm gonna talk about
you in a second.

522.22.text:
So to our graduates, let
me tell you about this.

524.79.text:
So I don't know
if you watched--

526.49.text:
did any of you watch the
NBA Championship last night?

530.46.text:
All right, so I'll tell
you what happened--

532.60.text:
Okay, so I'll tell
you what happened.

534.57.text:
Golden State Warriors won the
NBA Championship last night.

537.57.text:
I'm not much of a fan of the
Warriors, but they won anyway.

542.78.text:
And I was watching
it last night,

544.61.text:
and I've watched several of
those games during the series.

547.65.text:
So here's what I
watched last night,

549.92.text:
and I think it's always
impressive to me

552.22.text:
when I see sports teams
do what I saw last night,

555.92.text:
because there's three
things about the Warriors

558.52.text:
that I would tell you
that I noticed last night.

560.69.text:
The first thing is
that any team like that,

563.83.text:
that wins the NBA Championship,
Major League Baseball,

569.54.text:
any team like that, I notice
they work really hard, right?

574.91.text:
whether it's actually
the game last night,

576.61.text:
I was impressed at how hard
these guys were working

579.38.text:
to make sure they
reached their goal

581.18.text:
'cause they realized if
they didn't work hard,

585.12.text:
So the first thing
I noticed with them

586.69.text:
is how hard they worked--
they worked really hard.

589.96.text:
The second thing
I noticed with them

592.12.text:
is that in many--
especially last night--

595.46.text:
they had a lot of
people in that arena

601.97.text:
There were all kinds
of people there,

603.30.text:
cheering on these Warriors--
cheering on Golden State,

607.11.text:
whether it was Stephen Curry--
didn't matter.

614.95.text:
And the third thing that
I know about that team...

618.28.text:
is that while they
celebrated a lot last night,

622.32.text:
and they probably still
celebrating today,

624.26.text:
one of their next steps is
to think about next year.

629.36.text:
Because any time you
have a team like that,

631.90.text:
that works that hard and
has people cheering for 'em,

634.97.text:
they are celebrating but
then they're thinkin' about,

638.80.text:
"What are we gonna
do next year?

645.78.text:
So those are the three things
that I really noticed about them

648.05.text:
and I'm gonna tell you,
ladies and gentlemen,

650.32.text:
the thing I also thought
about last night was...

657.89.text:
Because I thought about
you in the same way

659.83.text:
that I thought about
Golden State last night.

664.90.text:
is that you
have worked hard.

667.17.text:
You have worked hard to
achieve what you just did.

670.70.text:
Now, whether that work hard
was the studying that you did,

673.77.text:
whether it was showing up
here for 18 weeks straight,

676.84.text:
where you're comin' in and
you've had to sacrifice

679.61.text:
time with family,
time with friends.

684.75.text:
You've had to say
"no" to some things.

687.49.text:
You've had to see
something going on

689.09.text:
and something that you
really wanted to be a part of

691.16.text:
because it was gonna
be something fun,

693.29.text:
but you said "no" because
you had either go to class,

696.53.text:
you had to study, you had
to go and meet some people

698.83.text:
to talk about what you're gonna
do the next day here in class,

702.23.text:
maybe you had to
come up here...

704.10.text:
so that you could work
on some of the equipment.

706.24.text:
You had to sacrifice,
you had to work hard,

709.51.text:
in order to achieve this
night where you sit here

713.75.text:
in front of me with
a cap and gown on,

723.36.text:
The second thing
is that you,

725.72.text:
just like the
Warriors last night,

727.36.text:
you have people
who cheered for you...

731.53.text:
and I think you're
lookin' at 'em right now.

734.10.text:
Not only are you looking
at 'em right here,

737.64.text:
You have people who have been
cheering you on this whole time.

740.54.text:
Some of you may have had
people sitting in this room

742.94.text:
who may have had to
watch kids for you.

745.58.text:
Or some of you may have
people sitting in this room

747.98.text:
who said, "You know what-- yeah,
I'll go get that done for you,"

750.58.text:
'cause they knew
that you had class.

753.95.text:
And maybe they did
something for you

756.09.text:
so that they could make
sure that you had the time

758.46.text:
and you had the ability to
be able to get this done.

762.06.text:
You had people
cheering for you.

764.16.text:
You had individuals that
said, "I got your back.

770.04.text:
"because I need to make
sure I support you

776.14.text:
So you had people
cheering for you.

784.25.text:
and as we all take the
opportunity to celebrate

790.86.text:
I encourage you to be very
proud of what you've done.

797.56.text:
Be proud of what
you've done!

800.23.text:
But then, I want you
to get up tomorrow

807.21.text:
Because what you have done is
that you have proven to yourself

811.51.text:
and you have proven
to these people,

813.91.text:
you have proven to those
instructors over there,

816.28.text:
that you can
get it done.

821.22.text:
You can go to school,
you can go back to school,

824.09.text:
and you can
complete a program.

826.59.text:
So what that
should say to you

828.16.text:
is that you need to think
about, just as those guys are

831.16.text:
this morning and today
and next week and whatever,

834.00.text:
who just won an
NBA Championship,

835.77.text:
they are thinkin' about what
next season is all about,

838.14.text:
I encourage you-- think about
what your "next" is, as well.

843.61.text:
Because what you have
accomplished should say to you

847.58.text:
that you can make
that next step.

850.15.text:
So it might mean that
after you have celebrated

853.62.text:
and after you've had
a good time, and saying,

856.76.text:
it might mean that you
come back to this place

860.33.text:
and you talk to someone
back there or over there,

865.36.text:
"Now that I got that one
done, what can I do next?

868.73.text:
"What's that next degree
gonna look like for me?

871.54.text:
"I wanna go after that
Associate's degree now.

873.77.text:
"What's that gonna
look like for me?"

876.08.text:
So that you can identify
what that "next" is.

879.11.text:
And don't let anyone put
any doubt in your head

882.08.text:
as to whether or not you
can get that done or not!

884.85.text:
You have proven that you can
get this kinda thing done.

889.86.text:
You can go to school
and you can complete.

893.93.text:
So now that you have done
that, what is your "next"?

901.50.text:
What I encourage you to do
is not allow the time

905.50.text:
that you have spent--
these last 18 weeks--

907.94.text:
do not squander
the last 18 weeks.

910.71.text:
Do not let the last
18 weeks just go to waste

914.45.text:
or get a piece of paper
and just put it on a shelf.

918.78.text:
Do something with what
you just completed!

922.86.text:
Whether that means
that you go to work,

925.69.text:
and you're makin' money
for you and your family.

928.06.text:
Whether that means that you say,
"Okay, what's my next degree?

931.16.text:
"What does it mean that I
go now to go back to school

938.20.text:
Or maybe you're
gonna do both

940.97.text:
'cause we have people
that do that, as well.

944.41.text:
I stood here just
a few weeks ago.

946.91.text:
We had another graduation
that we were celebrating

950.88.text:
And one young lady got up
and she talked about how

953.92.text:
she went through one
of these programs

958.06.text:
and then she went
to her Associate's--

960.89.text:
got into an Associate's degree 
program here at GRCC,

963.93.text:
she finished that,
and she was on her way

968.40.text:
to work on a
Bachelor's degree.

970.60.text:
And it all started
in a very similar way

983.95.text:
And you had people cheering
for you the whole way,

986.39.text:
supporting you, telling you,
"Yeah, you can get this done,"

989.46.text:
even in those moments that
you kinda had doubts.

992.66.text:
You had people telling you
you can get it done.

998.80.text:
and then you think about,
"What is my "next"?

1005.97.text:
Because as much as I'm going
to enjoy standing over there,

1009.64.text:
shaking your hand, while
they say your name

1011.81.text:
here in just a few minutes--
I'm gonna enjoy that.

1014.85.text:
I will really enjoy
celebrating with you tonight.

1018.95.text:
And I also will enjoy if
you choose here another one,

1028.03.text:
to be standing over
in our gymnasium

1031.30.text:
and having you walk
across that stage,

1033.70.text:
and shake your
hand over there,

1035.90.text:
as you complete
your next degree.

1055.49.text:
>> All right, if that
doesn't get you fired up,

1060.46.text:
Next, we're gonna
bring up John Doane

1064.20.text:
And as he introduces, you can
walk across the front here,

1070.10.text:
and shake hands with
all the dignitaries.

1086.49.text:
>> I would ask Gayl Beals
to come forward.

1179.14.text:
I would ask Moss Ingram and
Kwasi Joseph to come forward.

1349.31.text:
I would Steve Henkelman
to come forward.

1385.52.text:
I would ask Nathan Haney
to come forward.

1498.16.text:
It doesn't count unless
you shake everyone's hand.

1506.97.text:
I would ask Doug Wiersma
to come forward.

1700.33.text:
>> Is there anyone
we have missed?

1717.52.text:
>> All right, I like
all the yelling.

1721.42.text:
So we're gonna have
one more speaker

1723.39.text:
and then we're gonna
have some refreshments

1725.16.text:
and cookies and things
like that in the back.

1728.56.text:
So to say our closing remarks
and congratulate our graduates

1731.50.text:
one more time is our Dean of our
School of Workforce Development,

1743.04.text:
>> Well, I wanna add
to the 1, 2, and 3,

1756.72.text:
I would dare say that the
fourth thing that we could add

1761.09.text:
to Dr. Pink's is that that
team operated as a family.

1770.80.text:
You're now part of
the GRCC family.

1777.44.text:
We have not done enough
celebrating yet!

1780.48.text:
So Dr. Pink,
I need your help.

1782.28.text:
If you could come
up here, please.

1783.52.text:
I gotta put my imprint,
my thumbprint, in here

1786.22.text:
'cause like every good
celebration with a family,

1793.06.text:
So I'm going with
you guys over here.

1795.66.text:
We're gonna come
together a little bit.

1797.63.text:
I forgot my
selfie stick-- sorry--

1799.16.text:
or I would've
done this myself.

1801.67.text:
I gotta tweet
this out tonight!

1815.88.text:
>> All right, on a
count of three, ready?

1869.77.text:
>> Yeah, this is my
time now, Dr. Pink.

1871.64.text:
Sit back down, would ya?
(audience chuckling)

1875.14.text:
All right, now we gotta
get serious a minute

1876.87.text:
'cause this is the
important part, right?

1878.94.text:
Your tassel is on
the right-hand side.

1881.68.text:
You have officially
earned the right

1883.38.text:
for that puppy to be
on the left-hand side.

1893.22.text:
Let me be the second
person after Dr. Pink

1899.76.text:
We wanna see you back here
because now that you're part

1901.70.text:
of the GRCC family, we
need to know your story.

1904.97.text:
Stop back in, tell
us what you're doin'.

1907.14.text:
Tell us the great
job that you got.

1908.51.text:
Tell us what degree
you're gonna go after.

1910.91.text:
We really like to stay
in touch with our alumni,

1913.41.text:
and I'd love to have you
have a little picture

1915.95.text:
as you come in the
Tassell back there,

1917.78.text:
so let's try to
get those as well.

1920.05.text:
All right, you're part
of the GRCC family.

1922.79.text:
Now, it's time to celebrate
with your family.

1925.46.text:
Please go ahead and
enjoy some refreshments.
